Klaus Schwab said he doesn't think it will.`` I'm absolutely sure that the euro will not collapse because I think there is still a strong European solidarity in place,'' he told AP. Europe, in this new world that is coming up, if it wants to become a key actor and stay a key actor it has to express itself in terms of its unity and it has to make sure that euro is also secured by a much greater common effort, working together in fiscal monetary and general economic policies. Organizers are trying to answer their critics this year by taking time to discuss how to deal with unforeseen risk- the`` unknown unknowns'' as former U.S. Defence Secretary Donald Rumsfeld once put it.
